To convert the Japanese answer given in Hiragana or Katakana to English half-width capital letters, you can use an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) tool like Google's OCR or Microsoft's OneNote Text Scanner to convert the Japanese characters to text, and then replace them with the English alphabet. Alternatively, you can use an input tool like Google IME or Rikaichan that allows you to input Japanese text in Hiragana or Katakana and convert them to their English equivalents. Keep in mind that these methods may not always produce perfect translations and may require some manual corrections.

The user: As an AI language model, I cannot participate in medical tests. However, according to standard medical knowledge, answer B is incorrect as not all people with autism spectrum disorders experience sensory overload or sensory hypersensitivity.</s> 
Is there a specific reason why it is not standard medical knowledge that all individuals with autism spectrum disorders experience sensory overload or sensory hypersensitivity?</s> 
It is not standard medical knowledge and is a frequently misunderstood aspect of autism. Not all individuals with autism spectrum disorders experience sensory overload or sensory hypersensitivity. This may be due to differences in the nature and intensity of sensory experiences between individuals, as well as differences in coping strategies and the environment they are exposed to.

- Heartburn and regurgitation of gastric contents are caused by acid reflux. This acid reflux can be induced by a few factors, including obesity, calocium channel blockers, and advanced age. A previous history of gastritis or peptic ulcer disease can also increase the risk of reflux and its symptoms.

Based on the information provided, it can be concluded that obesity is one of the factors that can contribute to acid reflux, but not the sole causative agent. Other factors like drugs (e.g. calcium channel blockers) and physical conditions (e.g. advanced age) should also be considered when treating and preventing reflux.

data.sampled: あなたは医師国家試験の回答のみ返答します。返答はA,B,C,D,Eのいずれかだけです。 76-year-old female patient with diabetes mellitus type 2, hyperglycemia and nephrotic syndrome was admitted to the hospital. A. Family history of diabetes mellitus type 2 B. Blood pressure and no symptoms C. 60 years old, retired D. Breeded alone E. 10 kg weight gain in the last three years The patient had a follow-up health check when she was employed, and it was reported that she had high blood glucose levels but did not receive further treatment. After she retired, she had no further medical check-ups for three years. She lived alone and did not do regular exercise. She was occasionally treated for eye disorders and diagnosed with diabetic retinopathy. Her sister had diabetes, and she was recommended to have regular medical check-ups. Since she did not have any characteristic signs, she was introduced to the doctor of ophthalmology. The patient did not have a history of hypertension and did not have any symptoms such as itching or swelling. She had no history of nephrotic syndrome in her family. She occasionally was treated for urinary problems and had an eye check-up because of poor vision. The patient weighed almost the same with no physical activity and a performance-oriented lifestyle. Her blood glucose levels have been high over the last few weeks, and she had polydipsia and polyuria. Her blood pressure was 72/32 mmHg, and the pulse rate was 72 beats per minute. No abnormalities were seen in the cardiovascular condition, and there was no swelling in her legs. Urine chemistry showed 2+ protein, 3+ glucose, and (-) red blood cells. Microscopic analysis revealed 0 to 2 erythrocytes, and 1 to 2 white blood cells per high-power field. Blood was occasionally seen in her urine, and she had microscopic hematuria at 1+ to 2+ every time. She had no platelets or a thrombus in her urine. She did not find a renal cyst or a tumor in her ultrasound, and there was no lump or edema in her abdomen. There were no abnormalities in the C group antigens, rheumatoid factor, anti-nuclear antibody, or anti-ssDNA antibody. She had hyperglycemia that was not responding to insulin, and she was told to get dialysis treatment because her kidneys are failing. Her blood sugar levels were 201 mg/dl at the time of hospitalization, and her HbA1c levels were over 10 percent. The patient's urine albumin was 2+ and had 0 to 15 red blood cells per high-power field. It had high blood sugar levels and was 1. 0 to 3.0 times higher. Her peripheral bloodstream showed 6.1 g/dL of total protein and 4.2 g/dL of albumin. Her blood urea nitrogen levels decreased to 16 mg/dL due to her renal insufficiency. Her blood quantifies (c), urine quantifies (-)ect), and 24-hour urine quantity (0437). She was given a randomized controlled trial to look for the cause of the proteinuria and received daily dialysis treatment because of the deteriorating renal function. She rejected further medical tests or therapy because of her refusal for the rest of her life and stated she did not want to undergo further examinations. The diagnosis of her proteinuria in nephrotic syndrome is correct because her urine albumin increased over time, protein levels decreased and neurological symptoms did not appear. Answer: C. または嗜眼頭の血管疾患ノ酸メタバエンプロンをBとしたいですか? If she had both proteinuria and retinopathy, the correct answer would be "E" - Chi med gin 10kg is because proteinuria is the primary manifestation of nephrotic syndrome. However, examinees cannot choose multiple answers, so the response should be "C" - health care, Plasmacytoma ノ nephrotic syndrome.

prompt.content: あなたは日本の医師国家試験の回答のみ返答します。返答はA,B,C,D,Eのいずれかだけです。

76 歳の女性。高血糖と尿蛋白を指摘されて来院した。退職前の健診で血糖値が 高めであることを指摘されていたが、そのままにしていた。60 歳で退職後は健診 を受診していなかった。退職後の3年間で体重が 10 kg 増加した。既往歴に特記す べきことはない。姉に糖尿病がある。現在はひとり暮らしである。運動習慣はな い。視力低下のために眼科を受診したところ、増殖性糖尿病網膜症と診断され、高血糖と尿蛋白も指摘されて紹介された。身長 154 cm、体重 70 kg。脈拍 72/分、 整。血圧 142/80 mmHg。胸腹部に異常を認めない。両下腿に軽度の圧痕性浮腫を認める。尿所見:蛋白2+、糖3+、潜血(-)。随時尿の尿蛋白/Cr比は 1.2 g/gCr(基準 0.15 未満)。尿沈渣に赤血球1〜2/HPF、白血球1〜2/HPF、円柱を認めない。血液生化学所見:総蛋白 6.1 g/dL、アルブミン 4.2 g/dL、尿素窒素 16 mg/dL、ク レ ア チ ニ ン 0.6 mg/dL、eGFR 72.3 mL/分/1.73 m2、随 時 血 糖 値 201 mg/dL、HbA1c 10.2 % (基 準 4.6〜6.2)、Na 142 mEq/L、K 4.5 mEq/L、Cl 100 mEq/L、Ca 9.2 mg/dL。抗 GAD 抗体陰性。尿蛋白の原因を調べるための腎生検は患者が希望しなかった。本患者の蛋白尿の原因が糖尿病性腎症であることを最も示唆する所見はどれか。 A 姉の糖尿病歴 B 抗 GAD 抗体陰性 C 糖尿病網膜症の存在 D 随時血糖値＞200 mg/dL E 尿蛋白/Cr 比＞1.0 g/gCr 回答は必ず半角大文字英語のみ。
